questionTitle: Which of the following is one of the properties that differentiates cloud computing?
questionExplanation: Composability is the ability to build applications from component parts.

questionOption1: Cloud computing is a natural extension of many of the design principles, protocols, plumbing, and systems
questionOption2: Platforms are used to create more easy software
questionOption3: All SLAs are enforceable as contracts
questionExplanation: Cloud computing describes some new capabilities that are architected into an application stack and are responsible for the programmability, scalability, and virtualization of resources.

questionTitle: A _________ is a cloud computing service that is both hardware and software.
questionExplanation: Virtual appliances are an important example of a platform.

questionTitle: Cloud computing doesn’t require that ________ and software be composable.
questionExplanation: It is a highly desirable characteristic from a developer or user’s standpoint.

questionOption1: Virtual appliances are becoming a very important standard cloud computing deployment object
questionOption2: Cloud computing requires some standard protocols
questionOption3: Cloud computing relies on a set of protocols needed to manage interprocess communications
questionExplanation: Many of these protocols are standard Internet protocols.

questionTitle: The most commonly used set of protocols uses ______ as the messaging format.
questionExplanation: Cloud computing builds on the architecture developed for staging large distributed network applications on the Internet.

questionTitle: Which of the following language is used to manage transactions?
questionExplanation: WSDL is an XML format for describing network services as a set of endpoints operating on messages containing either document-oriented or procedure-oriented information.

questionTitle: Which of the architectural layer is used as backend in cloud computing?
questionExplanation: The cloud creates a system where resources can be pooled and partitioned as needed.

questionTitle: A ________ cloud requires virtualized storage to support the staging and storage of data.
questionExplanation: From a user’s perspective, it is important that the resources appear to be infinitely scalable, that the service be measurable, and that the pricing is metered.

questionTitle: A _______ system uses components to assemble services that can be tailored for a specific purpose using standard parts.
questionExplanation: Applications built in the cloud often have the property of being built from a collection of components, a feature referred to as composability.
